alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Ocean, northeastern Burlington and southwestern Monmouth Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cream Ridge, or 15 miles southeast of Trenton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Howell, Lakehurst, Allentown, Wrightstown, Leisure Village, Six Flags Theme Park, Pleasant Plains, Cedar Glen West, Jacksons Mills, Leisure Village East, West Freehold, Cassville, Adelphia, Clarksburg, Vista Center, Crosswicks and Woodruff. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 29. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 85 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern and central New Jersey.
